column2: firefightra, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I am a scuba diver; but, am plagued with nausea and vomiting when conditions on the water are poor.  I have been diving in Mexico and I started vomiting uncontrollably in the water and on the boat when the waves were high. I recently came back from the Dominican Republic and had the same problems.  I actually had to cut one of my dives short; because, I was vomiting underwater from the rocking of the ocean.  I talked to some locals and they suggested dramaine.  I was hesitant; because, I am very sensitive to drugs that may cause drowsiness.  I love to dive and thought that I would give it a try instead of cancelling the remainder of my dives. The next day we were caught in 10 - 12 foot swells both in the boat and in the water and I was very mildly nauseous...it was very bearable.  If I hadn't taken the drug I would have been extremely sick.  The only side effect was that after I had finished my dive I began to feel drowsy and had to sleep for 2 hours.  I felt groggy for the rest of the day; but, it was a mild side effect.  I took dramamine for the remainder of my dives and it worked like a charm.  I highly recommend it for motion sickness and you definately need to take it 1/2 - 1 hour in advance for it to work effectively.
